Reviews.Title: Vizio SRS - I have absolutely NO sound problems
Reviews.Author: Star
Reviews.Content: I have this TV and enjoy the sound and picture quality. I'm a soundaholic. If you've never had a stereo or srs/home theater sound... it DOES take some time to adjust. The sound can be *VERY INTENSE*.I suggest you adjust the sound; turn the TruSurround HD sound *TO OFF*, but do leave the TruVolumn *ON* (you can enter the graphic equalizer presets) use these to set the quality sound you enjoy most. When you do this it's of course 'best' to be playing music, music dvd IS BEST.If you SET the preset equalizer setting to *FLAT OR OFF*... you will be able to enter and customize the settings on your (*bass & treble*) levels.Don't hesitate to play around with the sound settings, one click will return it to the factory settings.You will require a lower volumn level, significantly lower... the audio quality IS dynamic and intense for this TV.

Reviews.Title: Nice TV -  good price
Reviews.Author: James C. Kelley
Reviews.Content: This review is for the 32" and the 47" Vizio as I have recently bought one of each. As far as I can see the menus, remotes and operations of the two units is identical. The screen size is the only difference.The picture is bright and sharp on both units. The 47" is hooked to 1080 HD (I use DishNetwork HD receiver) via HDMI cable and it is impressive - as you might expect for HD. The 32" is hooked to the coaxial input distribution system I use at my home and it is also a top notch picture for a simple coaxial cable hookup. However, please note that there is NO S-Video input at all and the COMPOSITE input (single yellow RCA cable) simply plugs into one of the three RGB COMPONENT RCA inputs. That's maybe a bit confusing but not a deal breaker for me.The remote is full featured as it controls screen size, input selection, Closed Caption and the like with dedicated buttons. Very convenient. The remote also accesses an extensive menu system that allows detailed adjustments of audio and video. Also found in the menu is a JPG viewing feature that allows you to watch slide shows and sort photos by plugging in a common USB drive. I plug the SD card from my camera into a USB card reader adapter, plug it into the Vizio, and review my photos right out of the camera. The USB jack on the rear left is a little difficult, but not impossible, to get to if the TV is flush mounted on a wall.PROS - these are not top of the line TV's, but I am of the opinion that most TV's have a pretty good picture if set up correctly. I use an Avia DVD to calibrate and it really does make a difference. I never use factory or preset audio or video settings - I turn them all off. More on that later as it pertains to complaints about poor audio performance from some reviewers. Also, the manual is written well and is useful and concise. I address the audio issues below but can say that the small stereo speakers on this TV sound pretty good although a bit weak in the deep bass. (Please note that anyone running this TV via HDMI but not using a surround audio system is missing half the fun of HD TV - namely the great stereo or 5 channel audio now available on most HD channels).CONS - I have noticed that once or twice the TV has turned off when I hit the EXIT button on the remote. While clearly a harmless software glitch, it has happened so infrequently that I debated even mentioning it. However, some others may have had more serious trouble with that issue so in the interest of full disclosure I mention it here.There are also complaints from reviewers concerning audio being too loud, too soft, and the volume going up and down! Folks, please turn off all audio enhancements on your receiver/cable box and the TV. Useless stuff with silly names like "Super Surround", "Big Bass Synthesizer", "Wide Sound Enhancer" "Video SuperSharp" and other useless factory settings should be turned off and left off! Check you receiver, your Vizio menus, and anything else in the signal chain and turn all of that extra crap off. Think about it, if you have both the receiver and the TV doing strange things to the pure, clean digital audio/video feeds - there is no telling how all those settings may affect each other. Did I mention turning off all audio/video helpers, enhancements and conditioners? If you want big sound buy a 5.1 surround system. Even the cheap ones sound pretty good these days and watching HD TV without 5.1 surround is like eating Oreos without any milk. This also explains why some of us really don't care how the TV sounds as we never use our TV speakers/audio at all!COMPARISON - my cheap 47" Vizio looks better than my neighbors very expensive 50" Sony TV. We both have DishHD service, we both use an HDMI cable and are using 1080i resolution. Why does my cheap tv have a better picture? Simple - buy or borrow a calibration disk and take 30 minutes to set up your TV - then write down the settings for future use if needed. I use an Avia but there are others just as good. IMHO most people would be hard pressed to tell the difference between these TV's and the high priced units some people buy - particularly if the video is calibrated correctly. If browsing in a showroom, be careful to ignore picture brightness as a selling feature as every TV salesperson knows that uninformed buyers will go for the brighter picture every time.Lastly, please be kindly advised that any digital HDMI or Fiber Optic cable will provide pristine, perfect audio and video feeds. The nature of digital means that the cable either works or it doesn't! The cheap HDMI cables sold here at Amazon and elsewhere will provide exactly the same 1080iHD picture and 5.1 audio as the "Super Monstrosity Mega" cable for ten times more money. Sales people may tell you different, they may even believe their lies, but I have no reason to lie to you as I don't want to sell you anything. One caveat though - if you are running a long HDMI cable run (say 25 feet or longer), you could have trouble trying to use a super cheap HDMI cable.I really appreciate the thoughtful reviews of others as a valuable buying tool and I hope this review has helped you too. Whatever brand you decide on - enjoy your new TV!

Reviews.Title: Sound is great!  Check the SRS TruVolume settings!
Reviews.Author: amj
Reviews.Content: I think that the Vizio folks should have made the default to OFF on the SRS TruVolume.  If they had I think several of the owners would not be experiencing the issues with the sound.  I set mine up, read the reviews, turned OFF the SRS TruVolume feature and now the sound is fine.I'm not sure how high the volume will go.  I've got mine on "2" and it is plenty loud and very clear.I purchased this to use with my new Xbox 360 with Kinect.  I'm replacing a 19" Sanyo that was purchased in 1989 by my older brother.  So, maybe my expectations are not very high...for $299 I'm pleased and it is a tremendous step up from what I had.

Reviews.Title: There are definitely sound issues with this model
Reviews.Author: Steve
Reviews.Content: I got this on a Gold Box deal.  This was to be used in the sunroom...which we could fit a 26 or a 32 in the spot.  I also bought two Vizio Razor LED 26" http://www.amazon.com/VIZIO-M260VA-26-Inch-Class-RazorLED/dp/B003LL17HK at the same time for bedrooms (all pre-black Friday specials).Living with all of them for four days...and I can see why this is rated 3/5 stars.  3 stars is generous.I am using cable through RF.  No cable box.  The sound issues I noticed is flipping between standard definition channels and HD channels.  For example, watching two football games.  If I go from an SD channel like ESPN to HD (local ABC), the sound on the HD channel is much lower.  I have to jack the volume up on the HD channel, then when I flip back to ESPN, it's way too loud.ABC HD is 13-1 and ABC SD is 13.  I proved the sound issue flipping back and forth between the two while a song was playing on the station... huge difference in sound.This is with TruVolume on....TruSurround on.  Honestly, I didn't play too much with the audio settings like another reviewer suggested because I shouldn't have to.  TruVolume should level out the sound between channels and commercials...and it apparently doesn't work.Another annoying thing is there is a delay when changing channels.  You flip up one channel...it delays 2 seconds...shows the picture and then delays another second to start sound.  Sounds minor until you start flipping channels and realize the annoyance...we had a cheap AOC LCD TV that did something similar...which is why I will never buy an AOC TV again.The Razor LED TV hooked up to the same RF cable does not have this delay...the picture and volume come up in a second simultaneously.  Also, the sound difference is much less...there is one, but its minimal and you don't have to change the volume level.The picture is not quite as nice as the Razor LED...but pretty good.  I did not try this with our DVR...but if you are hooking this up to a cable box and bypassing the tuner, you might not have these issues with sound and channel changing delay.  I don't want to have to rent another cable box to make this TV work. Plus I am not buying a computer monitor, I am buying a HDTV with a tuner that should work better.I like the Razor LED's, so this just appears to be a bad model in their line.  The Razor LED 32" is a 1080p set (http://www.amazon.com/VIZIO-M320VT-32-Inch-1080p-Backlighting/dp/B003PGX0VM/ref=sr_1_1?s=electronics&ie;=UTF8&qid;=1289411221&sr;=1-1) and a bit more than we want to spend.  I saw that in a store and it's nice.So four days in...and although 32" is significantly bigger than 26"...it's already at UPS tonight on its way back.  I'll use one of the Vizio 26" Razors as it's just a much better overall TV.

Reviews.Author: Q. Rashad
Reviews.Content: This T.V. works great and has real good sound....as for all the complainers of...("Sound")...If you just read the manual! or even read all the reviews....example: page (37) of your...(manual)... tip #7...."Bass & Treble" it tells you....for better...Sound.... your Bass & Treble will only! work....if! your....*...."SRSTruSurround HD" feature is...."OFF"!....So use your remote go to SRSTruSurround HD and put it on...Off....the sound will sound much better and if you want even more sound get the Vizio sound bar or even better... get the ..."Phillips"! DVD Home Theater System 1000 watts  it's a powerful! system for the price and you will get all the tv sound! experience you want and more....it has DVD/CD player FM radio and a IPod connector....and more it's a real great buy....at (Walmart).But again if you just want your VIZIO TV to sound better on it's own...follow the tip above (*)....hope this helped you guys out....good luck.

Reviews.Title: Sad day for Vizio
Reviews.Author: Steven753
Reviews.Content: Bought the TV at a great price, but right out of the box the sound quality was bad. The volume would jump around, hitting extreme highs and lows on its own, I didn't even have to touch the remote. After the fifth day, two lines appeared near the bottom of the screen, which signaled that a whole two rows of pixels had died.The plastic surrounding the screen was cheaply made and had warped.I upgraded to a Samsung 32" and so far so good.

Reviews.Title: Very Solid
Reviews.Author: J. Nelson "Moodyblues142"
Reviews.Content: As mentioned already about the sound quality. You definitely got to adjust the volume as it can get really loud or really soft. The picture quality is amazing though. The home setting might be a little dark. I prefer the movie setting or sports setting to get a little more light. It's a very good deal for the price they offer. Many HDTV's seem to struggle with sound quality but at least this one has some bass to it. And like I said. It's an easy fix by changing the volume for each program or a loud part of a program. Definitely recommended.

Reviews.Title: sound problems
Reviews.Author: Marion Hines
Reviews.Content: I am perfectly happy with picture on the Visio, but the sound is a terribleproblem.  My previous TVs sound stayed at between 3 and 6.  The Visio is allover the place.  Hard to hear or blasting from station to station it conatantlychanges and on a single station I have to keep adjusting the sound.  I amvery, very disappointed.

Reviews.Title: Sound advice
Reviews.Author: Morris Friedman
Reviews.Content: I purchased this item from Costco. It was priced at least $100 less than a comparable Sony Or Panasonic. I hadn't read the reviews beforehand. The sound would go from extremely loud to barely audible without anyone adjusting the volume control. I looked up the reviews and sure enough there were similar complaints. I returned it the next day and bought a Sony.

Reviews.Title: Excellent LCD under 300
Reviews.Author: MSI User "MSI User"
Reviews.Content: Excellent product under 300$. Ordered from Amazon and unit arrived within 5 days. Took <15mins to set it up to watch TV channels from cable box. Unit arrived in original manufacturer's packaging and not Amazon's packaging.Video: Excellent quality. Easily I can feel of the quality compared to my old tube TV :). HD channels are awesome. However regular digital channels do not look good. Anyways I am not going to watch regular channels going forward. :). Connected to laptop via VGA port and can use this TV as a monitor and to watch movies from Netflix/laptop. Bit confused about PC audio (port was not visible) and 30mins call with VIZIO resolved the issue.Audio: I saw many bad reviews here. However I am not seeing any issues. Turn off TRUVOLUME and everything will be fine. Playing from DVD players gives very good sound compared to regular TV channels.Happy with my purchase so far. Amazon is excellent in delivering the product on time. Will have one more review after a month or so.Purchase this TV if you are looking LCD under 300. You will not be disappointed with the purchase. DO NOT compare with bigger size LED TVs.

Reviews.Title: Pleasantly suprised and happy.
Reviews.Author: EAddison15
Reviews.Content: I am very pleased so far with my purchase. I look for quality and value in what I buy, and this TV delivered big time. The picture resolution is great as well as the sound, with no external speakers. The fit and finish of the set and stand are top notch. Setup was a breeze, plug and play. I'll be totally honest, for the price I thought this might be a dud, I was wrong and relieved. The TV is substantial in picture size and for a mid to large room its plenty. $300 Score!

Reviews.Title: Decent TV for the price. Do not buy if you will be using the built in TV Tuners!
Reviews.Author: Glenn
Reviews.Content: I picked this TV up for about $270 on sale. For that price, I think it was worth it. The picture quality is beautiful (minus standard def channels, which look horrific), the sound is more than adequate (I use it in a bedroom and can't really tell though), the viewing angle seems to be wide, and there are plenty of inputs. I do have quite a few pet peeves about the E320VA that I feel should be pointed out though:1. Volume fluctuates wildly if SRS TruVolume is on. Turning it off is a one-time, easy enough fix (just go into the sound menu).2. Rear inputs are designed HORRIBLY. There is very little room between the inputs and the case itself. This is notably troublesome if you're trying to use an antenna or cable straight from the wall, as stiff coaxial cable will have a very hard time bending into the area where the inputs are. The HDMI inputs weren't skimped on. They are very easily accessible, but are on the left side of the TV, which makes for an eyesore if you have multiple things hooked up via HDMI.3. Speaking of antennas and cables out of the wall, DO NOT BUY THIS SET IF YOU INTEND TO USE EITHER METHOD OF RECEIVING TV WITH THIS SET. The included tuner(s) is/are junk. It takes ages to switch between channels, and the ATSC tuner has trouble converting 1080i signals (used with some major broadcast channels, such as ABC/NBC) for use with this 720p set. Every few seconds, the picture freezes up for a splitsecond. This is EXTREMELY annoying and is not a problem with signal strength. Also, if you don't have the coaxial cable in the TV positioned perfectly, lips have trouble syncing up. Anything that uses HDMI cables thankfully bypasses the terrible tuner.4. The remote is of SHOCKINGLY bad quality. Some buttons can barely be pressed at all. Not a problem if you're only using a cable/satellite box.5. The "normal" picture mode leaves a few rows of pixels which display oddly (I'm guessing these pixels aren't used in the original broadcast image). "Widescreen" mode horribly distorts standard def images.6. The TV has randomly shut off a few times on me when I've been browsing the menus, but it has been a while since it last occurred. It has randomly shut off completely in the middle of playing a video game through one of the HDMI ports.7. Take this last complaint with a grain of salt, as I do not know the exact cause of my problem. Many times (10+) while playing on my Xbox 360 connected through an HDMI cable, I've had my sound die. Muting and unmuting solves the problem. I'm pretty sure the TV is at fault, but I suppose the 360 or HDMI cable could be the culprit (though I think the signs point towards the TV).

Reviews.Title: Great picture! good sound! ...not sure about the quality of the materials...
Reviews.Author: The piano guy
Reviews.Content: After reviewing and much consideration I bought this HDTV... in a few words: if your looking for great HD picture quality, it does the job! remember is not full 1080p HD... but hey... 720p is not bad at all for a 32" screen size. I don't have cable or satellite service, I simply get HD signal from regular air TV and of course most of the channels don't transmit in HD, but the main networks do and the picture is really impressive. I have read a lot of bad reviews about sound issues with this model, as for me, sound is very good, loud enough, true surround option is really cool, and if you take some time to read the manual or just get to know the menu options you can get pretty decent sound settings.The only thing I'm not sure about this model, or, if I may say about VIZIO is the quality of the materials they use to build their products, the "plastic" or whatever the material is called that surrounds the screen, like the main frame looks kind of weak, and in the few weeks I've had this TV, I have already noticed some dents, I'm not sure if I caused them myself while unpacking the TV... anyway, if you're like me and you put your dollars in high consideration when making a decision to buy something, it may be worth it. It costed me $299 no tax, no shipping, I got 6 months no interest in Amazon... so! Good luck!

Reviews.Title: Surprisingly good
Reviews.Author: Denny S. "Denny"
Reviews.Content: Vizio is a stunner. People expect low budget quality, but it's way above expectations. Competes with LG and Sony, I think.

Reviews.Title: E320VA
Reviews.Author: kaptan
Reviews.Content: Shipped to my door, unpacked and on the wall in 30 minutes.. Great picture, great sound, can't seem to get the closed captioning to work, but I think thats more of a Satelite reciever thing than the TV. The "Vizio" light in front is a little bright for a nightlight, it stays on when the TV is off so it works like a nightlight.. No problem.. took a black Sharpie, and colored over it.. now it's not so bright.. Other than those petty things it's a great TV.

Reviews.Title: black/blank screen of death
Reviews.Author: investordude
Reviews.Content: I have vizio 32" TV.  It's less than 9 months old.  TV just died one day with black/blank screen and it does not respond to any remote key press.  I had my reservation about vizio and I was right.  It's turned out to be a junk for me.  Total waste of my time and money.  Don't buy any Vizio.

Reviews.Title: Good TV for the price.
Reviews.Author: treyrg
Reviews.Content: I am a 15 year old boy who has to buy pretty much everything on his own. Some people think that I get everything I want because of my parents, this isn't true. I have bought many expensive things on my own, so when I bought this TV I was happy and disappointed at the same time. The sound goes really high and kinda low on it's own, so I have to change the volume a lot; the picture is good but in the settings you have to change it to fill the screen, and when you do that you can't see everything. Overall it is a good TV if you're looking for mediocre, but if you have the money to buy a better TV, then you should do so!-treyrg

Reviews.Title: very poor customer service; not worth the risk
Reviews.Author: Katherine Lagana "Kat Lagana"
Reviews.Content: Tv & remote worked fine for 3 months then stopped working (thus no tv). Online reviews indicated this was common. Vizio required that we show proof of purchase (even though we went through their tedious online registration process) to prove we owned the TV before they would help us. We were granted a "favor" of getting a new remote but warned that if the problem persisted we would need receipt even though online reviews indicated that replacement of remote did not always work. Told this was industry standard which is not true in our experience for Apple, Sony, and Bose. Highly recommend stick with Sony or other brand because Vizio support is poor.

Reviews.Title: Overall good...volume is annoying...and sound goes out
Reviews.Author: sandy ryan
Reviews.Content: Maybe it's something that can be fixed but I just got this a month ago & after I listen/watch TV for awhile the sound starts to sound like it's possessed & then just goes mute.  The TruVolume or whatever is QUITE annoying...it seems to work in the opposite way -- commercials are SUUUUPER loud & then the show comes back on and it's TOO quiet!! Maybe it's a setting I'm not using or maybe I should just turn off TruVolume...I'll try that.  If anyone else has this issue with this same model, please let me know what to do!! Other than that...good deal.

Reviews.Title: Avoid This TV
Reviews.Author: Mr. Rh1
Reviews.Content: I'm extremely disappointed with this TV. I bought it from Costco but it had severe backlight bleeding from all edges of the TV.. so I exchanged it and guess what? The replacement has the same problem, although not as bad.. but wait! It also has a dead pixel right in the center of the screen! Overall I wouldn't suggest this TV. The only good thing is the audio which sounds really great. It has really nice built-in speakers that provide adequate bass without needing to hook up external speakers. Another thing I don't like it the "Vizio" logo stays lit even when the TV is off. It's just creepy and I don't understand why they would do that.In conclusion, this will be my first and last Vizio TV. I'll be returning this model yet again and avoiding their products in the future.If they could fix the backlight bleeding problems and fix the logo thing then it would be a decent TV.

Reviews.Title: Revisit Review on Vizio
Reviews.Author: C. Tedesco "CT"
Reviews.Content: So we decided to break down and finally buy a Vizio after a few years of hearing pretty good things about them.  This TV, the E320A was a cheaply priced set for a 32inch.  Didn't really worry about it being only 720p on a small set like this.  I did not expect for the price to be wowed by this TV set and ...well...I wasn't.First issue I found out during installation,  the HDMI 1 does not work correctly. If I use that slot, I get weird specs that flash on the display. So I switched HDMI to slot 2 and the specs go away.  I can deal with that.Second issue, which I heard about in reviews here, is that the volume would fluctuate. Check.  Yup, it does, pretty annoying and suprising that a set does this in 2010.Third and most important issue I have found.  (UPDATE)  Now I think this is resolved. After reading the manual I noticed there as something called DCR.  If you don't want to go crazy turn this feature off.  It does not work correctly. The picture brightness fluctuated wildly. Now that I have turned this off it does seem to be better.  So I have edited my review and have given 3 stars up from 1.

Reviews.Title: Good picture quality, poor sound... spend the extra money for something nicer
Reviews.Author: rocket89
Reviews.Content: After hearing terrible things about Vizio television quality, I went ahead and took my chances anyways because of the good specs of the tv, etc. At first the tv was alright, although the remote is crappy and half the time the buttons don't work. The picture quality is good, not too much to complain about, I had to adjust some settings and the auto brightness was a joke. Overall I decided to return the TV as the sound quality even for a flat panel was/is subpar. My advice is to spend a little more money and get something that will last. The design is nice, but for $30 more I decided to get a Toshiba brand.

Reviews.Title: My first Vizio
Reviews.Author: Ricus
Reviews.Content: This is the first time I have purchased a Vizio product and I am very pleased. While others seem to complain about the sound quality, it is clear that they do not know that you have to adjust the bass and treble during the setup on all newer TV's. While I will admit, it is not as easy as it should be, once you turn off the SRS, you can adjust it with ease. I see no reason to bash the sound quality due to the lack of knowledge to adjust the sound tone and/or be able to read the manual to see how to do it. If you decide not to look at the instructions, get your kid or grandkid to set it up for you and stop complaining about it. Lastly, the picture is much better than I had expected for a lower cost TV. Overall, I give this 5 stars for great value, better than expected picture, and excelent sound for tiny speakers that come with LCD/LED TV's. The four HDMI, USB, Component, and VGA connections make this set very versatle. My only con is the hi gloss finish that they use on the remote and TV. The 720P/60Hz is fine for most bedrooms and I bet most viewers. If I get 10 years out of this TV, I am happy.Best of luck to everyone!

Reviews.Title: Terrible product! Terrible company!
Reviews.Author: Samsam
Reviews.Content: I decided to try this company - Vizio- and was extremely disappointed. About a month into getting my tv, the sound decided to get really choppy and then completely cut out!!! This happened every so often- whether I was watching cable or a movie or even Netflix! The tv got so screwed up a couple times that the whole thing completely shut off after losing the sound! I attempted for Vizio to fix it twice, but neither worked. They replaced it and it's still having the same problem. I give up

Reviews.Title: Board suddenly crashed
Reviews.Author: Library Lady
Reviews.Content: I've loved my 32" Vizio for about two years.  Then suddenly, the blue screen of death.  Apparently the motherboard just died.  My son says it's not the brand, it's because I bought a floor model which had likely been on continuously.  On that basis I'm replacing the board at a cost of $150 and hoping nothing else suddenly goes wrong.  Has anyone else had a similar problem?  Thanks.

Reviews.Title: TV NO GOOD AFTER 7 MONTHS!
Reviews.Author: LoverofLife
Reviews.Content: When we first received the TV we loved it but after 7 months of limited use it, the TV now has a split screen.  This TV is not used all the time and when it is it's only used to watch TV & on occasion to watch DVD's. We received the TV on March 12, 2011 and today is Nov 14, 2011.  We are now trying to do a hard reset but I am upset at the quality.  We had a huge 37 inch dinosaur TV by Sanyo that lasted us 10 years and it only broke because the movers dropped it! We had plans of purchasing a 55 inch Vizio today by that is OUT OF THE QUESTION!  I will never purchase this brand again!!

Reviews.Title: Sound and picture issues
Reviews.Author: Dave
Reviews.Content: Bought this as a gift for my 80-year-old parents.  They hated it.  The Tru-Surround and Tru-Volume were worthless.  The volume would go from "can't hear" to "deafening" arbitrarily regardless of the viewing source.  The sensor for ambient light would make the screen go almost black.  When I turned off these three options & adjusted the sound and picture, it sounded as though the actors were speaking out of tin cans.  Never got the picture to stay anywhere close to right for the parents.  Lucky Amazon let me return it.  Got a 32" Philips LCD tv to replace this and so far they love the Philips.  Caveat Emptor.

Reviews.Title: It would have been great but the sound.....
Reviews.Author: ABC
Reviews.Content: Based on the price and the features, I was hopeful that this TV would have been terrific for our bedroom.  Unfortunately, as soon as we turned on the TV and started watching, the sound began to sputter and eventually went silent. We had to turn to a different channel and back again to get the sound to return. This continued with greater occurance and by the 5th day, I gave up and boxed it up to return. We have another Visio that we purchased about 3 to 4 years ago and never had any issues so this was very disappointing.  I'll spend additional $$ as needed and purchase another brand to replace this TV.

Reviews.Title: vizio volume all over the place
Reviews.Author: john
Reviews.Content: Vizio  NEVER again,  volume is very inconsistent I spend to much time adjusting.Just check consumer complaints you will not buy,

Reviews.Title: Good value
Reviews.Author: Jaywrx04
Reviews.Content: I purchased this TV in a hurry. I research similar TV's and discovered it is a pretty good deal. Great price and and great quaility. I have had it for over 3 months and I am very pleased. This TV replaced my 32" Samsung plasma that burned out after 3 years of use. The only negative is the surround sound setting can get a liitle loud randomly, I use it in basic setting because it is in my bedroom. I give it 4 1/2 stars out of 5 overall. I would recomend this product to a friend.

Reviews.Title: Horrible Experience
Reviews.Author: Matthew
Reviews.Content: We bought this set on Thanksgiving Day for my wife's apartment - she lives away for work.  It didn't get used at all between Christmas and New Year's.  In early February the sound started acting up after less than six weeks of actual use.  The sound problems were different than what has been described here.  Too late to return to Amazon so we had to contact Vizio.  They sent a local, contract tech out and after more than two hours of working on the TV he said the problem was the TV.  Vizio HQ said their guy was wrong and the wife had to call the cable company.  Comcast also said it was the TV. End result is all they will do is give us a refurbished set.  Own the TV for two months, use it for less than that and they won't give us a new set.  The picture is great but the company is terrible.  A product is only as good as the company that stands - or doesn't stand - behind it. If a new set only lasts 60 days, how long before the refurb dies?  We escalated to supervisors and supervisors' supervisors to no satisfaction.

Reviews.Title: Sound is terrible, picture dims for no reason
Reviews.Author: Joe
Reviews.Content: I turned off all special sound settings on this thing and it still had gross inconsistencies when changing channels. Some channels needed to be cranked to 50 and others were plenty loud at 8. I tried playing with the trusound and truvolume settings and nothing helped. The other problem I had with this display is the backlight would randomly dim and undim even with the ambient light sensor turned off. I was extremely disappointed with this set and wish I'd taken the warnings in other reviews seriously. Returned it and picked up a TCL which is great!

Reviews.Title: Google "Visio TV Black Screen Of Death" Before You Buy Visio
Reviews.Author: D. Bitz
Reviews.Content: I bought a Visio LCD TV from a warehouse store 3 years ago (but I do a lot of purchasing on Amazon also). Reviews.Title: Good TV, not Great, but Good
Reviews.Author: jagger_27
Reviews.Content: Bought this as a xmas gift for myself (something to play xbox 360 and wii on) and I have enjoyed it so far. I noticed a problem with the sound like many others but I simply turned the trusurround off and made a world of difference. Even with the trusurround off the tru volume feature is great and has a surround sound effect itself. I have a small surround sound set up that I am going to hook up as well.The picture:I can see why this gets mistaken for 1080p. The picture is great and the tv comes with several picture settings to cater to your preferences (movie, gaming modes etc.)The sound:Like I said before the sound is fine once you turn the trusurround off. I'll give you an example of what the trusurround is like when it is left on. I was watching a WWII movie on Netflix. I put the volume at 30/100. First scene involves a lot of shooting and it was loud, I mean really loud. Finally the shooting ends and there is some dialogue, barely audible! In another scene there was some whispering, extremely loud again! Its almost as if the trusurround attempts to predict when it should be loud and when it needs to be quiet and it is wrong 90% of the time.Overall:For the price, its hard to find anything better. Great picture but has some sound problems that are easily fixed. 4/5 stars based on price and picture and minor sound issues

Reviews.Title: You Get What You Pay For
Reviews.Author: Two Zero
Reviews.Content: If you're looking for a TV for your primary viewing in your family room, living room, or den, or even a good quality TV for the bedroom, then keep looking.  But, if you're just looking for something that sits in the corner and mostly provides background noise while you focus on something else like your computer in your home office, or at your workbench in your garage or home shop, then this is a low cost option.  Because the $299 price tag at Costco which includes a $73 instant rebate is hard to beat in a name brand 32" LCD HD TV.  But, the volume control on this thing is junk.  The volume drifts up and down on its own, not just from program to commercial and back, or channel to channel, but even within the same program.  For me, it still works because I usually have the volume down where the fluctuations are less noticeable or even muted completely while my focus is on whatever game I'm playing on my computer.  The TV is there to let me keep an eye on a race or a football game.  But, if watching a specific program or even on TV is my focus, I'm in the family room watching on a 46".  If I had bought this for the bedroom to watch TV or a movie in bed, it would be on its way back to Costco.  No excuse for Vizio to screw up something as basic as volume control.

Reviews.Title: Ok, not great
Reviews.Author: B87
Reviews.Content: I purchased this TV about 3 years ago and have been using it as my main living room tv ever since (it's probably too small to be a proper living room tv, but I guess that's  matter of personal preference).  I am not a tech person and I really just bought it because it seemed like an ok size and the price was right at the time.  The TV has been ok, but in retrospect I wish I had done more research.  It's totally functional and it's never broken, but there are some issues.Issues:-Sound is the worst problem.  It is very hard to hear dialogue, so I end up turning the volume waaaay up to hear it, and even then it's still difficult.  But then if music or background noise in the show comes on, it's waaaaay too loud.  Like I said, I'm not a tech person, so maybe it's somehow possible to fix this, but I have never found a way.-Picture is ok, but not great.  When it's really bright in the room, it gets a lot worse.  Again, it might be possible to fix this if you know what you're doing, but I certainly don't.-Takes a long time to turn on and a long time to change the inputs.  When you turn it on, it takes several seconds to boot up.  More annoying is the inputs.  To change from one input to another you have to keep pressing the input button and scroll through all the inputs to get to the one you want (you cannot just select the one you want without hitting all the others first).  This is not a huge deal, but it's annoying if you switch inputs frequently (to switch to the Roku or the DVD player etc).So basically, it's not the worst TV out there, but I think that you could probably get a much better set for not that much more money.

Television workes great so far.  I see quite a few reviews complaining of volume issues, thankfully I haven't had that or any issues with this set. Loved the purchase.

Reviews.Title: Good for the Price
Reviews.Author: AnnieW
Reviews.Content: This TV has a good picture quality and if you turn off the TruSurround, the audio is much better. I waited for it to go on sale and have been happy with the purchase so far (I've had the TV about 2 months)

Reviews.Title: Excellent product--Surprisingly good sound!
Reviews.Author: Christian Hauck "JD4JC"
Reviews.Content: This is my second Vizio HD purchase, the first a much smaller screen. I was unhappy with the sound on the little one, but connected it via the headphone mini-stereo output to my house sound system (it doesn't have a dedicated sound output). This one has very acceptable sound through its internal speakers, and great picture and setup menus.

Reviews.Title: VIZIO E320VA 32-Inch Class LCD HDTV, Black
Reviews.Author: brandy
Reviews.Content: Just got this TV today very nice picture sound is not an issue i did see the tv cut off when i pressed the menu button but it could have been my own error as of now about an hour into it a very good buy very nice HDTV with HDMI cable.

Reviews.Title: Great upgrade
Reviews.Author: Cory
Reviews.Content: got this tv when my older smaller TV wouldn't play anything with HDMI. it was a great deal, great sound quality, have noticed sometimes the screen can become dark but that could be because of the lighting in my dorm.great TV get the Square D warranty, great company to work with

Reviews.Title: Sound is a MAJOR issue
Reviews.Author: BB
Reviews.Content: I don't know how it is with a cable or sat box, but using it off straight cable, the sound is a major issue.  The sound levels between an SD station and an HD station are radically different.  A 25 volume level for an HD station equals a 7 level for an SD station.  If I watched the TV regularly I would have sent it back immediately.  But, I only watch it infrequently and I can live with it (barely).The lag time between channel changes is way too long.Lighted "Vizio" is an annoyance, but electrical tape does the trick.

Reviews.Title: Vizio 32"
Reviews.Author: azrigali "bobbie"
Reviews.Content: I have this TV in my bedroom & I don't appreciate the Vizio logo lighting my room, ie put tape over it. Also, it takes too long to receive a picture after you hit the ON button. OK for price...

Reviews.Title: BROKEN WHEN DELIVERED
Reviews.Author: cpg
Reviews.Content: The TV is OK (as they go)but for the $12 I saved from Wal-Mart, I wish that I had purchased from them. The reason is because the TV was delivered with a pixel-wide blue line through the middle of the picture. If I had bought locally, I could just take it back, but now I have to repack, make shipping arrangements with the factory (not Amazon) and hope that they can get it back in a month or two. Amazon is better for things that don't break.

Reviews.Title: vizio e32ova 32 inch class lcd hdtv, black
Reviews.Author: tobykat
Reviews.Content: Its everything you claimed it was. I read reviews about sound problems with this unit, but I was willing to chance it. I'm glad I did. There was no sound problems of any kind. the picture is excellent, its like a brand new unit, in which you would have a hard time telling the differnce. For the price, you are getting more than meets the eye.  I would like to yhank the folks at Amazon for having such a great deal.  I bought for my girlfriend an she fell in love with the picture quality. Thanks again Amazone keep up the great deals on fine quality products.tobykat01

Reviews.Title: Happy buying USA over all
Reviews.Author: Chris Clark
Reviews.Content: From Horicon Wi,  Happy with Vizio no complaints at all.  Just happy to keep buying USA as much as possible.  Keep the money at home to keep families working  all around this Still Great Nation power to the hard working people.  God Bless You all.

Reviews.Title: Vizio E320VA Tv
Reviews.Author: Giovanni
Reviews.Content: I bought this tv thinking it would be horrible. I recieved it set it up with a hdmi cable and was shocked at what I saw. The picture was sharp and clear and the sound sounds great. If your looking for a low priced tv this is the one.

Reviews.Title: Vizio TB
Reviews.Author: Michael's Mom
Reviews.Content: I have been very pleased with my purchase from the selection process to the delivery.  I chose this TV from sitting in my office.  I had spent an afternoon going from Store to Store and prices varied.  This was delivered in 24 hours to me at my office. I wished I had just started here and there would not have been any running around.  I liked the brand name.  I still have to get used to the double numbers from regular to HD but other than that its fine...Great pic.  Easy set up.

Reviews.Title: Moms happy
Reviews.Author: Chris
Reviews.Content: This was a christmas gift for my mom. She is very happy with the product. Has no problems at all. Everything was easy to hook up and she had no problems.

Reviews.Title: Nice TV
Reviews.Author: D. Clogston "Blue"
Reviews.Content: Needed a TV for the bedroom and this fit the bill. I have a 37 inch in the living room that i have been very happy with so I went with this one. Worked very well right out of the box, the picture is rich and colors are great.Loved the timer being on the remote so I can set it and go to sleep, my 37 inch you have to drill down into the menu to put it on timer.Great TV for the price, only thing I see as a con the sound get louder and softer when it goes to commercials or another channel.

Reviews.Title: One of the best purchases I've ever made!
Reviews.Author: sweetK
Reviews.Content: My new Vizio 32 inch LCD TV is absolutely the best, sleekest TV I've ever had.  The picture and sound quality is superior to most others I've seen in stores.  Vizio  has put together a great product at a great price.  Less than $300.00 for the best TV I've ever had in my life.  Very happy with my purchase. Check it out!  VIZIO E320VA 32-Inch Class LCD HDTV, Black

Reviews.Title: Not even worth a dollar
Reviews.Author: happy
Reviews.Content: Sound fluctuates from one minute to the next.  Takes about 30 seconds for the TV to turn on, about 25 seconds to change from one channel to the other.  When using the DVR, TV turns off by itself when recorded show is over.Did try to fix problems with Vizio customer service chat.  She was very nice and seemed like she tried to help.  She did give me some crazy excuse of:  it takes a while for the Fios box and the TV to communicate with each other that's why it takes a while for the TV to respond.So happy I bought this from Amazon hence it was an absolutely hassle free return process.

Reviews.Title: great price
Reviews.Author: Brad
Reviews.Content: Amazon delived this on time and in good condition. The price I paid was 200.00 cheaper than Wal-Mart.Plus delivered to my door.

Reviews.Title: Vizio
Reviews.Author: CRAIG
Reviews.Content: Everything okay except for sound quality.  I installed this TV in my bed room and ended up putting my old TV back due to the sound quality.  I had a panasonic LCD that was 6 years old and it smoked the Vizio in sound quality.  Everything else matched pretty much.  If you get a sound bar or a suround sound system you will be good to go.

Reviews.Title: Good only if...
Reviews.Author: Amazonlady
Reviews.Content: My tv was DOA. It's a great tv but took two months for vizio to send me a new one. A lot of them not contacting me back and processing. If yours works on the first try then great. But the customer service you are buying with the product is awful to say the least.

Reviews.Title: The sound is strange.
Reviews.Author: KelcieR
Reviews.Content: We bought two of these for our boys bedrooms and they really love them. It's quite a change from the big tube TV's they were used to.What I don't care for is the sound. They are loud but in a strange way that I can't quit describe. It's rather annoying and I'm constantly asking them to turn them down.The other complaint I have is that I have to turn the TV off and on for it to recognize the attachment. It's frustrating. I'm always getting "no signal" when I know it's plugged in and working fine.They do look great in their rooms!

Reviews.Title: Good TV for the price
Reviews.Author: drfred
Reviews.Content: I bought this for a bedroom set since I watch very little television in bed.  It has an ok picture.  The problem is that it was not compatible with my Direct TV remote.  Direct TV says that it is not in their system so I have to take a few extra steps to use the remote with Vizio.  For the price, I'm happy.

Reviews.Title: Low Sound
Reviews.Author: seanyb
Reviews.Content: The picture quality of this device was great, but the sound is low and there is also a sound delay when switching channels.

Reviews.Title: Sound sucks
Reviews.Author: Janice McGill
Reviews.Content: It is ok for the price I guesss but  the sound sucks big time on the hd channels, you are almost blown out of your chair when a commercial comes on and then the sound will go up and down during programming and this is using the sound correcter setting, can't remember what it is called.

Reviews.Title: Great TV for Price
Reviews.Author: destinkathy
Reviews.Content: I love my Vizio television.  I got the 32" & it is perfect for my needs.  I know someone who has a 42" Vizio & is extremely happy with it, that was what made me go with this brand.

Reviews.Title: HD TV
Reviews.Author: Jerry D. Hemmingson
Reviews.Content: I bought this set for my office and I was impressed with the picture with only a 720 picture I see no quality lost when comparing it with the set in our family room. It took a lot of playing around to get a good sound quality but once I found a setting to my taste even the sound is good.For the price I believe this set is all than can be expected

Reviews.Title: Vizio E320VA 32-Inch 720p LCD HDTV, Black
Reviews.Author: Reba Jones
Reviews.Content: I bought this TV for my crafts room!!  It is perfect!  The only thing is the sound is a little weak, but when I close the door and lay on my futon to watch it...it is perfect in all aspects!  The picture is great!!

Reviews.Title: Vizio E320VA 32-inch 720p LCD HDTV Black
Reviews.Author: pjac3407
Reviews.Content: I Just Love it.  The picture is just Beautiful, sound was kind of funky but I made the corrections that were recommended in the reviews and am now a happy camper !  The price was just great and I used my american express points and the price came down even lower ! And the free shipping made it even a better deal.  If you are looking for a great television for little money, this is the one for you !  ENJOY !!!

Reviews.Title: Ordered wrong TV
Reviews.Author: Wayne J. Hendricks
Reviews.Content: I bought a Vizio E320VL last year and liked it so much I ordered this one thinking it was the same TV. My mistake was I didn't see the VA instead of VL. I thought the picture was just as good as the VL but the sound was always changing. The connections on the back are not as good also. I returned this TV and got another VL and am very satisfied.

Reviews.Title: Awesome product for low price
Reviews.Author: Paul A. Hinkle
Reviews.Content: I spent a lot of time reviewing TVs before I finally purchased my Vizio. After 3 weeks of owning it I still really love it. It is the perfect TV for the college student that I am. I only have two thing about the TV I would like better. 1) The tuning on the TV is a little slow. The picture pops up about two seconds before the sound kicks in, and even the picture takes about 2 seconds to tune to a different channel. The other thing is that the AV input is the same as the composite input, which was really confusing at first.All and all this is an excellent TV, and if you're in the market for a good TV but don't want to break the bank, buy without concern.

Reviews.Title: Good tv
Reviews.Author: T. mckneely "power man"
Reviews.Content: I got this tv to replace a older lcd tv with out a tuner. It is a nice tv set. Light weight and good video. Audio sounds right to me I turned off every thing in the audio menu and turned the bass up and it sounds great.Qam tuner works and found all my tv channels. Hdmi works like it should. I do like the tv and would buy another one. Now the remote is ok but I wish it was not so long. I like for a bedroom tv to have a short remote and less buttons. But it works so I am happy.

Reviews.Title: Not bad for the price
Reviews.Author: Robin
Reviews.Content: We bought a 47" Vizio at Walmart a few months ago and have been fairly happy with it.  My son bought one from Amazon around a year ago and he had done a lot of research.  I ordered the 32" model as a Christmas gift for my husband.  The price is great (cheaper than Walmart) but the sound is all over the place.  You have to constantly change the volume when you change channels.  We feel this is part a problem with Vizios and part a problem with Verizon Fios cable system.  We have this tv mounted outside in a covered area.  We didn't want to get an expensive tv so this one fits our needs.

Reviews.Title: Excellent product! Super prize!
Reviews.Author: Marcin Gorski
Reviews.Content: To be honest, for the price I paid, I expected complete garbage. But, to my surprise, the television I received is totally perfect! I don't know what all these other reviews are talking about when they say the sound quality is bad. My televisions sound quality is super and the picture is also super. No complaints about this television at all!!! Totally perfect!! Great prize too!

Reviews.Title: Our new Vizio tv
Reviews.Author: Sandra B. Gordon
Reviews.Content: We are so glad that we purchased our Vizio.  Clear big picture, good sound.  We are just loving it.  Price very good too.  Thanks again

Reviews.Title: Great TV for the money
Reviews.Author: g-boro
Reviews.Content: I read a lot of reviews about this TV and was a little worried about the sound.  Turning the enhanced sound feature off completly solves that problem.  For the money, I couldn't image a better TV.  I have it set up in the bedroom and am VERY happy with it.

Reviews.Title: Great Value but some features not available.
Reviews.Author: Bluebell
Reviews.Content: I love this TV.  It has great picture and looks nice in my living room.  What I was disapointed with is the lack of connections on the back. If your device does not use HDMI, then forget it.  You have to buy a converter so that your autio cables can input via the Coax cable connection.  I thought we would be past this by this day and time.  The sound will go up or down based on whether you are watching a DVD, TV, or Playing a game.  You have to get used to the sound options on the remote.  Otherwise this is a great upgrade for someone with an older TV.

Reviews.Title: Great tv
Reviews.Author: RB
Reviews.Content: This is great tv with a great price. It was a gift for someone and they love it. They had never had an HDTV before and were blown away by the picture. The volume seems a bit low even when cranked up but it could have been the room it was in but not a big deal for them.

Reviews.Title: Definite Sound Issues
Reviews.Author: James T Wilson
Reviews.Content: After carefully reading all the reviews for this tv I decided to buy one anyway, and use the Menu choices to select my sound preferences. But like others, I had issues with the sound. The volume was not level; it would slowly increase, then decrease, then increase again, to astonishing levels. And this was all in the same scene; not changing channels. I used it with TruSurround "ON" and "OFF"; no difference. I tried it with TruVolumn "ON" and "OFF"; again, no difference. I also experienced the long delay in sound after changing channels. It was annoying.I bought this after arranging for satellite service. After hookup, the satellite box had problems "recognizing" the Vizio. The "fix" was that I had to separately turn on the satellite box and then the tv. After that, the satellite remote would work all functions. The technicians said that they see probelms with Vizios quite frequently. I had no similar problems with the Sony in another room.On the plus side, the picture is really quite clear.With Amazon's outstanding return policy, I am returning this set and buying another SONY.

Reviews.Title: Perfect
Reviews.Author: J
Reviews.Content: Beautiful picture! Can't say I have any sound issues. Plenty of options to tinker with the sound to your taste...

Reviews.Title: Vizio 32" TV
Reviews.Author: elidarey
Reviews.Content: I got this for my Dad as a gift because his old 19" tv was going bad. I had heard many good reviews about this brand so I went with it. My Dad is happy so that makes me happy, too!

Reviews.Title: Vizio 32" LCD HDTV 720P
Reviews.Author: Gary J. Craig
Reviews.Content: Shipping was fast and TV arrived with no damage.  During setup the only problem encountered was that with component cables I could not get sound.  I went and bought an HDMI cable for $15.00 and sound then worked perfectly.  I believe it was the cable box audio jacks that were bad because prior to giving it as a gift, for Christmas, I had hooked it to my box at home and it worked on component cables. I would buy again and the price was the best I could find.  Very happy with the experience.

Reviews.Title: Vizio E320VA 32-Inch 720p LCD HDTV, Black
Reviews.Author: Tenndawn
Reviews.Content: This is a great TV, especially for the price.  I was a little leary after reading the reviews with sound issues, but I took the chance and bought it because we already own a larger Vizio and it has worked great for several years.  This TV did seem to have sound issues at first, but we simply adjusted the volume controls: as stated by other reviews and it works great now.  No sound issues.  I recommend this TV.

Reviews.Title: Visio 32" LCD TV
Reviews.Author: Carol Paulsen
Reviews.Content: Picture quality is great, no sound problem.  I have not used it for any other applications except to watch TV.  Great buy for the money.  As far as the lighted VISIO logo on the bottom of the frame, it is not bright and distracting.  I have the set in my bedroom and am not bothered by that at all.  Am very happy with this purchase---thank you Amazon!!!

Reviews.Title: Excellent product for the price
Reviews.Author: CLH
Reviews.Content: I bought this TV on special during the Black Friday/Cyber Monday frenzie.  I have not been disappointed.  Other reviewers commented on the sound.  It sometimes jumps sound, but not a big deal.  I will be hooking it up to  a sound system anyways, so this is not a concern.  Good brand, great price -- what more can you ask for?

Reviews.Title: Bad luck, but not a bad model
Reviews.Author: Jason A. Kentros "SharkByte"
Reviews.Content: Before I give my review, I have to comment on the other reviews for this model.  There is a LOT said about audio issues, but the sound on this is remarkably clear and gets plenty loud.  I did turn the TRUSurround off but left everything else alone.  I don't like "simulated" surround sound, because if I want a home theater I'll buy a home theater system that's designed for that purpose.  I saw one review that said "no sound on HDMI connection".  That doesn't automatically mean the TV is bad and I'd recommend trying another HDMI cable if you have that issue.  I've seen picky TV's before and knowing that you can get an HDMI cable anywhere between 20 - 60 dollars and even less than 10 dollars, it's obvious that some may not be as good as others.  If there are issues with sound or picture (other than a dead pixel which obviously means it is a bad unit), you can mess with sound and picture settings to tune it to your preferences.  Not every TV will come ready to use out of the box with settings that EVERYONE will like.It has 4 HDMI connections, 1 Component video connection, 1 VGA and coax (cable/antenna).If there is ONE thing I wish this unit had, it is at least one set of audio/video inputs.Most gaming systems use the red/white/yellow A/V connection and none can be connected to this TV.  However, this is the era of HD devices so this TV is just keeping up with the latest trends and is perfect for use with an HD box and a Blu-Ray player and maybe a laptop with an HDMI connection.  Every brand has a bad unit now and then, but I don't think this is is a bad model, so for anyone who has issues with theirs, play with the settings and you'll be pleased.  Of course, as I said before, if you have a dead pixel just return it.***ADDED FEB 14TH***After increased use, we noticed that the picture seemed dull and dark, even after making several adjustments and even trying the "Vivid" picture mode that is used in stores.  I ended up exchanging this for the Panasonic TC-32LX24 at Costco, which has one less HDMI connection, but two a/v inputs and a component video input, as well as an SD input for picture viewing.  I spoke with someone at Costco who says that I probably just got a bad unit, possibly one with outdated firmware.  I noticed that the display model in the store looked great and far brighter and more vivid than the one I had returned, which is what led me to buy it in the first place.I chose to switch to Panasonic for a better variety of inputs and a better track record, and the price had been reduced so it was $20 less than what we paid for the Vizio.  Our other TV is a 42" Panasonic plasma that is nearly 6 years old that still looks AMAZING and it's only 480P (enhanced definition) since we bought it when HD was still pretty new and a full HD model was $1000 more.

Reviews.Title: Great picture and hard to beat for the price
Reviews.Author: cthlaw
Reviews.Content: Hook this up with to HDMI, kill the SRS sound adjustment in the menu selection for sound, and it's a great HDTV for the price.  It has to have the HDMI connect.  If you don't turn off the SRS, it has sound issues, in that you'll get odd volume increases.  Without the SRS on, no problems noted.  This television replaced an old 19" analog set in the kitchen, and I couldn't be happier.  The picture is crisp.  It's worth every bit of $300.

Reviews.Title: BETTER PRICE THAN SAMS
Reviews.Author: nanax5
Reviews.Content: THIS MAKES THE SECOND VISIO WE BOUGHT(FIRST AT SAMS)IT WAS A LOT BETTER PRICE AND WAS RECEIVED SOON AFTER ORDERED.

Reviews.Title: Great TV for the price!
Reviews.Author: Tracy Kenyon
Reviews.Content: I had read the reviews and bought the TV at a local store with the idea I could return it. You have to adjust the picture and the sound and once you do this, everything is awesome. Right now I have the sound on 19 and it is plenty loud and clear. If you play your blu ray videos through a blu ray capable computer, you must do this with only with the HDMI otherwise it won't play. Took us awhile to figure that out. I wish they made that more clear on the manual.

Reviews.Title: Picture is nice, but sound is not.
Reviews.Author: kristy
Reviews.Content: I purchased this TV for our bedroom.  It was replacing my 19 inch Magnavox (Tube) TV that I have had forever.  Of course when you are use to an older TV like, this picture is much better.  However, I'm disappointed with the sound.  When you have the volume really low, the sound is very muffled.  I think next time I purchase something I will not think about the $50 or $100 that I will be saving and purchase something with better reviews from the start.

Reviews.Title: Be Patient
Reviews.Author: Cobra
Reviews.Content: After reading the negative reviews, I thought I would still give it a try.  After all, you can't beat the price ($289.).  First thing I noticed when I set it up, the factory settings were terrible. I had to adjust everything.  I turned off the Surround Sound and DCR (and left them off), experimented with all the settings, and finally had a pretty good picture and much better sound. I don't know why the owner's manual doesn't specifically tell you everything you need to know to make personal adjustments. If you're willing to be patient, this TV is a bargain.

Reviews.Title: Cheap but not worth it
Reviews.Author: J. Young
Reviews.Content: I purchased TV from Costco because it was cheap.  I had read the reviews before hand but I thought I would try it out since Costco has a forgiving return policy.Overall I am dissatisfied with the product.  The picture is nice given you are on an HD channel-- if you're not using, the normal zoom will give you a smaller picture.  The distortion from using the "wide" setting is somewhat acceptable.  Viewing angle isn't bad but there is a noticeable difference especially if you get too low.As others have mentioned there are definitely some sound problems.  I should mention I am using standard cable (coax cable directly into the TV no cable box), so you might not have these problems with a cable box.  The volume equalization from truVolume is garbage; it doesn't even work-- the commercials are still way louder than the main program.  Like the other user the "HD" stations are much softer than the normalAnother beef I have with the TV is the channel searching.  The 50 some "digital" stations it found are blank channels with no picture or are not even available.  And the digital channels are not even numbered helpfully.  ie) the HD channel for 8 is 83-8 or 7 is 116-1.  There's no real way for me to figure this out except to channel up through each channel and figure out what it is manually and then add skips to those channels in the channel set up.Also connecting it up to a computer can be problematic.  It can only accept up to 768 px which resticts my computer to only a 800x600 output (not wide screen aspect ratio).  This is more a computer problem but it's something to consider if you were planning on playing video from your computer.In my opinion this TV is a waste of time and money especially if you don't have a cable box or HD subscription.

Reviews.Title: Weird....
Reviews.Author: Lakshmi Dent
Reviews.Content: This is one of the strangest TVs that I've ever seen.It seems like Vizio wants to brainwash their customers. Underneath the screen, there is a Vizio logo that is lit up. Constantly. There is no way to change this in the (poorly designed) settings. It takes 15 seconds to turn on. While turning on, it flashes the Vizio logo for 5 seconds.The TV, at least this particular one, seems to have a problem with HDMI inputs. The day I got this, the TV would seemingly crash if too many menu options were pressed at once. It would also restart every 20 minutes or so whenever using an HDMI input. That was finally fixed later. The TV takes a while to switch inputs, as well.The sound is awful. Absolutely awful. The volume fluctuates up and down randomly (there is an option in the settings to turn this ridiculous "feature" off, but it took a while to find), and there isn't a simple 3.5mm output to connect somewhat decent speakers or headphones to it. To quote directly from the box, "We included a handy SPDIF port for all your digital entertainment needs!"Nobody who buys this cheap brand has fancy digital equipment.The picture quality is good, but the display seems to attract every light source in the room, making it hard to watch TV during the day.It's pretty bad.

Reviews.Title: Quality TV, great value for the price
Reviews.Author: Chris
Reviews.Content: This Vizio TV is extremely quality for the price.  For the past 2 months, this TV has been in a bedroom, utilized daily, and works great.  Last week we moved it into the living room next to our 46" Samsung, and the Vizio was visibly less sharp of a picture than the Samsung.  However, for the price of the TV, the picture is just fine and the TV works great.

Reviews.Title: As Advertized
Reviews.Author: iknowmatt
Reviews.Content: For under $300 (got mine for $298 on Turkey Day) you can't go wrong. Picture in 720p is crisp and colors are excellent. The sound settings need to be played with but sound quality is fine once you find the settings that work best for you. I had an issue programming the TV with my satellite and called customer service (I found the manual a little vague)...there was a rep on the line very quickly and he resolved the issue immediately. Other than that, the set up is simple. My family uses the TV for our Wii and the picture is awesome! Enjoying the purchase so far & would recommend!

Reviews.Title: poor quality TV
Reviews.Author: Conure "Vet"
Reviews.Content: This is a poor quality TV. The sound is choppy. The picture blacks out. The TV turns itself on and off. The positive thing in this experience is Amazon.com's easy no hassle return policy.

Reviews.Title: Crashes more then Windows Vista
Reviews.Author: N. Westbrook "~Kizmar"
Reviews.Content: Got this TV at CostCo, thought it was a great deal until I used it for a few days. This thig has serious volume leveling issues. It'll either blow your ears off or be way too quiet. Theres not much in between.The biggest problem with this TV is that it will cut out and actually reboot itself manually. It happens nearly every time we use it.We have a 42" Vizio in the living room thats awesome, they apparently screwed something up on this one though. Avoid this TV.

Reviews.Title: About the Vizio E320VA inputs and outputs
Reviews.Author: azulmarino
Reviews.Content: I bought this TV on an impulse when I ran into its low price on F-a-T (Friday after Thanksgiving).B4 opening the box, I thought I'd better check out its inputs/outputs in a less hurried atmosphere; went back to the store to examine the display model. If you don't care about this stuff, stop reading right here.I was disappointed to see 4 HDMI ports, a VGA port, and not much else. What were they thinking? Do yourself a favor if you're an enthusiast: go to the Sony website and read the full specs for the Sony KDL 32BX320. This Thanksgiving weekend, you could get all that for another $55 above the Vizio price (not on the Sony site.)In my view, plus considering the mixed reviews on the Vizio, definitely worth it to get the Sony (or a Samsung) for a few bucks more,each buttressed by glowing reviews on several sites and featuring a rich complement of inputs/outputs.Picture quality on the Sony and competing Samsung is outstanding, with no audio issues.No doubt about it, I returned the Vizio.

Reviews.Title: Perfect buy
Reviews.Author: lola
Reviews.Content: The TV arrived on time, and I must say its a worth every penny, and more. I would recommend this tv to anyone wanting a perfect clear viewing experience.

Reviews.Title: ok for price but crappy sound
Reviews.Author: debbie
Reviews.Content: For the price, this is a good buy overall. I didn't want to pay a lot for a set, since I don't watch very much TV. The picture quality is pretty good, although the sound quality is terrible.  The TruSound is a joke...it absolutely DOES NOT work.  And like another reviewer stated, the volume has to be adjusted drastically from one channel to the next.  If the volume is set too high, it has a really "tinny" quality to it.  So, just keep in mind that you are getting what you pay for with this set.

Reviews.Title: BB
Reviews.Author: BB
Reviews.Content: So far, have not had any problems with the purchase of my new 32 inch Vizio TV. Would recommend this product.

Reviews.Title: Trust me- the sound is awful and has a mind of its own!
Reviews.Author: Suzanne Cantey
Reviews.Content: I bought this television for my daughters room- picture is good but the volume has a mind of its own... It can be a normal volume and then on full blast- it goes up and down without touching the volume control- overall- wish I would have read the reviews first!

Reviews.Title: amazing tv! !
Reviews.Author: Sergio
Reviews.Content: My package came on time. It got here way before the estimated delivery date. Got here in one piece and works perfectly with no problems at all. I would recommend this TV to anyone else its a great TV one of the best one out there if u are looking for a 32 inch LCD TV. I amcompletely satisfied with this TV. This is thv you should get...

Reviews.Title: DO NOT BUY IT FOR A BEDROOM
Reviews.Author: SRW
Reviews.Content: It was cheap and I wasn't expecting much- the sound and picture quality were fine but what I didn't know was that the VIZIO logo beneath the screen is lit up even when the television is off. It does dim but it is still pretty bright. So it was like having a little flashlight shining in your face when you are trying to sleep. We had to unplug it the first night we put it up so we could sleep and then it went back in the box to return it the next morning. Would be fine in another room.

Reviews.Title: A best buy
Reviews.Author: Audrey
Reviews.Content: I bought this TV for my bedroom. When it was delivered inside my door, I found I could not pick up the box, so I slid it across the floor to the room. Once opened, not only could I pick it up and lay it on my bed to attach the base, I was also able to hook it up. What a picture and sound. On top of it all the price was great. It truly was a best buy for me.

Reviews.Title: Flat screen tv's are the way to go.
Reviews.Author: Virginia
Reviews.Content: The sound goes up and down on some channels.The picture quality is great.I love the price. It was a Christmas present to myself.I didn't purchase the warranty.Overall I am very satisfied with my purchase.

Reviews.Title: Stay Away -- Buyer Beware
Reviews.Author: Ricky Jones "Eustace Scrubb"
Reviews.Content: Whatever you buy, stay away from vizio. The product is cheap, only lasted 12 months and 2 weeks, and they refuse to help in any way. Terrible product, stay away from vizio.

Reviews.Title: Amplifier feedback
Reviews.Author: Daniel A. Garcia
Reviews.Content: I connected the vizio to my Sony amplifier using the TV option on the vizio menu.  But I am getting a huge humming feedback from the amplifier... any ideas how to fix this?

Reviews.Title: Vizio needs help!
Reviews.Author: Angry VA Consumer
Reviews.Content: I have a 26-inch Vizio, which works well, so I bought a 32-inch.  Big mistake. Excellent picture, horrible sound quality.  Took it back, got another one.  Same problem.  Took it back and bought Samsung.  Brother-in-law in MO repeated my mistake with same results.  Vizio has a sound component problem with this model, probably others.  Vizio needs help!  Do not buy this TV at any price!

Reviews.Title: Not adequate for my needs
Reviews.Author: S. Judkins
Reviews.Content: I purchased this as a TV for my home office and as a monitor for my laptop. It will not take a VGA signal despite having an RGB port for a DB-15 cable. All it displays is "Invalid Format". The manual says that the VGA resolution should be set to 1360x768, but that is an uncommon setting. In fact it is not available in Control Panel for my laptop. It's disappointing because my Vizio 42 inch TV that I purchased 3 years ago has never given me a problem with VGA input.

Reviews.Title: Wonderful Service!!
Reviews.Author: Ana Beverly
Reviews.Content: The person who sold me this tv was the kindest, most courteous and dedicated person I've ever met! The product is wonderful, works beautifully and came with everything that it said it would. I appreciate everything from the seller and would DEFINITELY buy from them again!!

Reviews.Title: Beware of TVs that come with a rebate!
Reviews.Author: T. B. Dockter
Reviews.Content: I bought this TV at Costco today. It was $372 with a $73 rebate for a total of $299. Unfortunately, the TV is not worth $50. The sound is a definite problem. The volume changes at a whim during a program and changes from channel to channel. The extreme loudness when a commercial comes on you makes you jump -- and reach for an pair of earplugs. The picture clarity, color, and brightness are fine on the TV. But when viewing a DVD it is way too dark. For instance, on the latest "Friday Night Lights" DVD (which I have previously watched), there is a scene where Riggins shows Becki a piece of property he bought. The scene is shot during the day, but on this TV screen the scene is so dark it looks like night. When the camera pans wide to showcase the beautiful Texas landscape, you can't even see it! According to the Vizio booklet, you can make one of three pre-selected settings but can't fine-tune adjustments for brightness, color, or saturation. This TV proves the theory: You get what you pay for. Vizio is going back to Costco tomorrow!

Reviews.Title: No sound via HDMI, AV picture is poor quality.  Not worth the trouble.  No support.  Typical American company quality... ZERO.
Reviews.Author: Hai Phung "Concerned consumer"
Reviews.Content: Bought a Vizio 32 LCD at Costco.  Price was good, cheap.  When I set it up, I figured out why.  No sound through the HDMI connector.  Picture looks good, but no use if there is no sound.  So I tested out a few HDMI devices, but the issue remained the same.  I used the AV connector, there was sound and picture, but the picture quality was very poor in HD. I tried all kinds of configuration, but still poor quality.  I contacted Vizio, which was painful and really no support.  You have these character's acting as if they are doing me a favor by me buying their company's low quality products.  Their final diagnosis was, "If you did everything I said it should work.  I don't know of any kind of issue like this.  Thanks for choosing Visio, Bye!".So I returned it to Costco and spent extra money into a Samsung product.  I have 3 Samsung LCD's and they all worked with no problems, confusing configuration issues, and high quality picture and sound.  I suggest never buying any Vizio products unless it is extremely cheap, then you expect to spend hours to get it setup.

Reviews.Title: I hope it works ok, and thanks for sending it unwrapped
Reviews.Author: Wolffie
Reviews.Content: I was not happy with Amazon's decision not to rebox this in a plain cardboard box, they did not offer to even gift wrap.  My son (to whom it was a present) seen it when the delivery driver pulled up.It had been mishandled by UPS, box dirty and ripped open, just be aware when purchasing large electronics online, especially as a gift.The TV has a clear picture, and a plethora of HDMI inputs.  It does lack RCA inputs, which sent us scrambling for HDMI cables.The sound quality is very bad on this model. I would recommend adding external speakers if this is a problem.
